description: Earlier this year, we discussed an example of the Streisand Effect in action when a large home builder, Taylor Morrison, petitioned the Arizona Board of Technical Registration to discipline Cy Porter, a home inspector who has built up a large online following by posting videos of his inspections. He does that to educate Arizona homebuyers […]
title: Taylor Morrison Fails To Get Disciplinary Action For Home Inspector That Posts Inspection Videos

description: Can the fear of students using generative AI and the rise of questionable AI “checker” tools create a culture devoid of creativity? It’s a topic that is curiously one worth delving into a bit more deeply, in part because of something that happened this weekend. Earlier this year, we had a post by Alan Kyle […]
title: AI Checkers Forcing Kids To Write Like A Robot To Avoid Being Called A Robot

description: Having completely shit the bed in its handling of a recent ransomware act, the city of Columbus, Ohio has decided the person who must be silenced — and, hopefully punished — should be the person who informed city workers and residents their PII was available on the dark web. The messenger hasn’t been shot quite […]
title: Judge Grants City Restraining Order Blocking Researcher From Accessing Ransomed Gov’t Files

description: The 2024 All-in-One CompTIA Certification Prep Courses Bundle has 10 courses to help you prepare for various certification exams. Courses cover IT fundamentals, Network+, Security+, Could Essentials, Linux+, Server+, PenTest, and Data+. The bundle is on sale for $40. Note: The Techdirt Deals Store is powered and curated by StackCommerce. A portion of all sales […]
title: Daily Deal: The 2024 All-in-One CompTIA Certification Prep Courses Bundle

description: In today’s episode of ‘Won’t Someone Think of the Children?!’, celebrity attorney David Boies is leading a baseless charge against Meta, claiming Instagram is inherently harmful to kids. Spoiler alert: it’s not. This one was filed last month and covered in the Washington Post, though without a link to the complaint, because the Washington Post […]
title: David Boies’ Baseless Lawsuit Blames Meta Because Kids Like Instagram Too Much

description: Despite the best efforts of automakers and companies like Apple, states continue to push forward with popular “right to repair” reforms that make it easier and more affordable for consumers to repair tech they own. While they vary in potency, New York, Oregon, California, Massachusetts, Colorado, Maine, and Minnesota have all now passed some flavor of right to […]
title: Appliance, Tractor, And Irrigation Companies Lobby Against Military ‘Right To Repair’ Reforms

description: The fractured entertainment streaming environment we’re currently in continues to be a problem. Where’s that thing you want to watch? Well, not only could it be in one of a dozen places today, depending on what agreements have been worked out with content owners, but where that content can be streamed might also change in […]
title: ESPN Releases Tool To Help You Find Where To Watch The Game. Thanks, Fractured Streaming!
